s2d.math

Class Vec

  • java.lang.Object
    • s2d.math.Vec

  • public class Vec
extends java.lang.Object
    A two-dimensional vector class that can do most simple vector calculations.
    Useful for velocities, positions, and accelerations.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • createVectorAlgebraically

        public static Vec createVectorAlgebraically(double x,
                                            double y)
        Creates an algebraic vector from the origin to the given point.
        The magnitude and angle are determined automatically.
        Parameters:
        x - The X length of the vector. Can also be called the X coordinate of the head of the vector.
        y - The Y length of the vector. Can also be called the Y coordinate of the head of the vector.
        Returns:
        A Vec with the given properties.

      • createVectorGeometrically

        public static Vec createVectorGeometrically(double angle,
                                            double magnitude)
        Creates a geometric vector with the given angle and magnitude (length).
        The x and y coordinates are determined automatically.
        Parameters:
        angle - The standard angle, in radians, of the vector.
        magnitude - The length of the vector.
        Returns:
        A Vec with the given properties.

      • createZeroVector

        public static Vec createZeroVector()
        Creates a vector with zero length.
        Returns:
        A zero vector.

      • copyVector

        public static Vec copyVector(Vec vec)
        Creates a vector identical to the given Vec.
        Parameters:
        vec - The Vec to be cloned.
        Returns:
        The cloned Vec.

      • add

        public Vec add(Vec vec)
        Adds the given Vec to the current Vec
        Parameters:
        vec - The Vec to be added to the current Vec.
        Returns:
        A new Vec, which is a sum of the two.

      • subtract

        public Vec subtract(Vec vec)
        Subtracts the current Vec by the given Vec.
        Parameters:
        vec - The Vec to subtract from the current Vec.
        Returns:
        A new Vec, which is the sum of the current Vec and the negative of the given Vec.

      • cross

        public double cross(Vec vec)
        Determines the two dimensional cross product of the two vectors.
        Parameters:
        vec - The Vec to be cross producted with the current.
        Returns:
        The cross product of the two vectors.

      • dot

        public double dot(Vec vec)
        Determines the dot product of the two vectors.
        Parameters:
        vec - The Vec to be dot producted with the current.
        Returns:
        The dot product of the two vectors.

      • angleBetween

        public double angleBetween(Vec vec)
        Determines the angle between two vectors in radians.
        Parameters:
        vec - The Vec that should be checked with the current.
        Returns:
        The angle between two vectors in radians.

      • opposite

        public Vec opposite()
        Determines a vector directly opposite to the current Vec.
        Returns:
        A Vec opposite to the current Vec.

      • projectOnto

        public Vec projectOnto(Vec vec)
        Projects the current Vec onto the given Vec.
        Parameters:
        vec - The Vec to be projected onto.
        Returns:
        A Vec that is the projection of the current Vec onto the given Vec.

      • multiply

        public Vec multiply(double i)
        Multiplies the x and y components of the vector by a scalar amount.
        This scales the magnitude by that amount as well.
        Parameters:
        i - The scalar that should be multiplied into the vector.
        Returns:
        A new Vec after the multiplication.

      • divide

        public Vec divide(double i)
        Divides the x and y components of the vector by a scalar amount.
        This scales the magnitude by the inverse of that amount as well.
        Parameters:
        i - The scalar that should be divided into the vector.
        Returns:
        A new Vec after the division.

      • truncate

        public Vec truncate(double limit)
        Shortens the vector if its magnitude is greater than the limit.
        Parameters:
        limit - The maximum magnitude of the vector.
        Returns:
        A new Vec with a truncated magnitude. Will return this if the magnitude of the vector is less than the limit.

      • normalize

        public Vec normalize()
        Normalizes the vector by returning a vector with the same angle, but a magnitude of 1.
        Returns:
        Returns the normal of the Vec.

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Returns:
        The angle of the vector in radians.

        angle - The new angle in radians.
